title: FT: Various T's, E's, M, and R for T206 Commons
author: Jason Carota

posts.post_title: FT: Various T's, E's, M, and R for T206 Commons
posts.post_content:
Looking to trade the following for low grade (poor,) raw T206 commons:

[IMG]http://www.huntington-rogers.com/img/type/t/t209_type_2.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.huntington-rogers.com/img/t210/series3/t210_series_3_okc_walsh.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.huntington-rogers.com/img/type/e/e95_phila_caramel.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.huntington-rogers.com/img/type/e/e121_80.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.huntington-rogers.com/img/type/e/e254.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.huntington-rogers.com/img/type/r/r313_natl_chicle_fine_pen.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.huntington-rogers.com/img/type/m/m_unc_bos_herald_stahl_1909.jpg[/IMG]

I am new to the pre 1950 cards so I have no idea of value or even what it is but I really like the looks of the Walsh card with the red border. 

What is it and what kind of value do you want for it? I have no T206's right now but recently bought a 10 card lot of beaters to start my T206 collection and will get 2 Jimmy Slagle cards and would trade one of them for the red bordered Walsh card.

On a different note I see you collect Ellis Burks. I have a super rare 1990 Ellis Burks/Steve Lake Score wrong back pair. These are some of the rarest error cards there are. If interested in them let me know and we can discuss details.
After some research I figured out the red bordered card is a T210. I am still very interested in in. Do you have a sell price or a trade value.
